H0.text: Amino acids are the acids that proteins are polymers of.

H1.text: Lipids are the kind of acids that proteins are polymers of.

H2.text: Lactic is the kind of acids that proteins are polymers of.

H3.text: Acetic is the kind of acid that proteins are polymers of.

A4.text: Amino acids are the precursors to proteins. They join by condensation reactions to form short polymer chains called peptides or longer chains called either polypeptides or proteins.
